Text:
Did you know that there are countless other worlds
beyond our own?
I take it you aren't talking about outer space.
I'm talking about entire other dimensions.

We refer to the worlds that exist there as Realms.
For example...

Worlds frozen pole to pole in ice, worlds so
poisonous that no life can take root there,
worlds of searing flame, empty worlds devoid
of light and color.
And worlds populated by powerful monsters.
Now, all these Realms orbit around a single point.
Even our world is no exception.
What's at the center of it all?
Who knows? Perhaps it's God.
That is to say, even you couldn't observe it.

What I'm saying is that we're still in the midst of
observing it. Don't interrupt the lecture.

But whatever's at the center is the least of our
worries.

The problem is all these worlds orbiting around.
Round and round they spin.

As the years go by, every so often, the worlds
collide.

When different worlds connect for a moment, what
happens is... Let me give an example.

We performed a geological survey, and what it told
us was that ten million years ago, there was no
magic in our world.
And that period—

Coincides with when we came into contact with a
Realm. In other words, it poured a colossal amount
of magic our way.

And when that happened, it had drastic effects on
our ecosystem.
So, that's why the dragons went into decline.

Exactly ten million years ago. They failed to adapt
to the magic that flowed in from the Realm.

And those that succeeded prospered where the dragons
once thrived...
Humans...
However, this theory has a few holes.

Perhaps, like magic and magical beasts, humanity
itself might originally hail from a Realm, as well.
Wait, people...?

There are still a lot of mysteries revolving around
us.

We stand head and shoulders above all the others in
terms of our intellect and our prosperity.

It begs the question—are we even native to this
world at all?

Magical beasts, magic, and the diverse humans who
manipulate such things...

Our world has been sent many things from Realms, but
the inverse is true as well. Sometimes, the Realms
suck things away from us.
You mean, like getting spirited away.
*gasp*
Exactly.
Long, long ago...
An entire nation vanished in the blink of an eye.
Where, then, did Atlantis go?
...To a Realm.

This is an observed fact. Our world and the Realms
interact with each other on a cyclical basis, and
when they do, each one exerts influence over the
other.
So did the demon Diablos come from a Realm as well?

The demon itself was born and raised here, make no
mistake.
But the same isn't true of the original.

The original organism that became the basis for
Diablos came from a Realm—one that we've taken
to calling the First Realm.
The First Realm...

We've acquired a wealth of knowledge from Diablos.
That's one of them.

I'm sure you've figured it out by now. Tell me what
you think the Black Rose is.

It's an artificial gate that can connect...our world
to other Realms.

Once, the Oriana Kingdom opened the gate completely
by accident. In a single night, a hundred thousand
Velgaltan soldiers surrounding the capital were slain.

But this country didn't escape unscathed either.
After that, magical beasts began to pour in by the
bucketload and devour the people.

That's why we closed the gate and saved the
kingdom...

It seemed only reasonable that they give us fair
compensation.
Compensation? From the kingdom...?

That's right, compensation. Namely, blood...royal
blood. This time, it was your blood we wanted.
*gasp*

You were blessed with incredible amounts of magic,
even for a royal, and by all rights, they should have
turned you over to us as a baby.
But that fool of a king refused to.

The blood of the heroes who defeated Diablos runs
thick in the Oriana Kingdom. The Cult needed that
blood...for their experiments.
That wasn't the only compensation the Cult demanded.

Huge amounts of your tax revenues went to them as
well, and the original reason the Oriana Kingdom
invested so heavily in the arts was so it could
entertain them.

On top of that, the way your churches persecuted
dark knights was a way for the Cult to prevent
Oriana from gaining the strength to rebel against
it. Your father wanted to break the cycle.

He forged an alliance with Midgar, worked to fix his
twisted nation from within, and tried to secede from
the Cult.
And because of that...they killed him.

It can't be... You mean, the reason he allowed me to
study abroad...
He was trying to get you somewhere safe.
Father...!

Heheh... This is the outcome. Oriana will be
destroyed because of such foolish parental love.
Next time, we'll have to create a better kingdom.
What...?

I won't let you! I'll pick up where my father left
off...
That's for us to decide.
*gasp*

A mere puppet of experimental subjects like you has
no say in the matter. You and Oriana will soon be
destroyed.
By Ragnarok, ruler of the Fourth Realm—

The moment Mordred sneers, a lump descends from
the sky.
